items.sentence: Do you think Tom would be willing to do that for us?
Tom hasn\'t had time to do what you asked him to do.
Tom is my neighbor, but I don\'t know him very well.
I can\'t tell you how much your support means to us.
I could tell you that I love you, but I\'d be lying.
I couldn\'t convince Tom lend me the money I needed.
I couldn\'t prevent Tom from eating all the cookies.
How long has it been since you\'ve had a girlfriend?
According to the bus driver, it wasn\'t an accident.
You had no choice but to do what Tom told you to do.
You have to keep doing that for another three hours.
You have to study French whether you like it or not.
I don\'t want to get involved in that sort of thing.
I expect that Tom won\'t do what you want him to do.
Have I already told you about the book I\'m writing?
Have you decided when you\'re going to go to Boston?
Tom and Mary couldn\'t pay back the money they owed.
Tom and Mary don\'t want to walk home by themselves.
I can usually tell when someone is hiding something.
The doctor told Tom that he should drink more water.
The girl insisted on going shopping with her mother.
The last thing I want to do is leave you here alone.
Better the devil you know than the devil you don\'t.
Bus drivers aren\'t the only ones who are on strike.
I always pay for dinner whenever we go out together.
I am thinking of getting it translated into English.
I answered your questions. Now let me ask you a few.
I asked Tom if he had a cold, but he shook his head.
I asked around and everybody says Tom is a good guy.
I want to thank you for picking Tom up after school.
I want you to tell me everything you know about Tom.
I wanted to ask Tom why he had never gotten married.
Do you think that Tom and Mary will want to do that?
Focus your attention on the really important things.
Have you ever heard that music played on the guitar?
I didn\'t want to catch a cold, so I didn\'t go out.
I don\'t mind the cold, but I can\'t stand the heat.
I didn\'t know that Tom used to be a French teacher.
I didn\'t know that Tom wanted to do that on Monday.
I didn\'t know whether Tom needed to do that or not.
I didn\'t know whether to stay here or go to London.
I didn\'t mean to eavesdrop, but I did overhear you.
I didn\'t realize I was supposed to be here by 2:30.
Did you really think I wouldn\'t find out the truth?
Tom found the information he was looking for online.
Tom gave Mary three dollars and John thirty dollars.
The baby was sleeping soundly in his mother\'s arms.
I don\'t think I\'ll have the time to do that today.
Why didn\'t you tell me that Mary was Tom\'s mother?
Why didn\'t you tell me you didn\'t know what to do?
